player: Mike Muscala (ankle) will not play Saturday vs. the Sixers.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play Tuesday vs. the Nets.
Joe Harris (sprained left ankle) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. Charlotte.
Sean Kilpatrick and Trevor Booker will rest against the Pelicans on Friday.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) has been ruled out for Friday against the Pelicans.
Jonas Jerebko (illness) will not play against the Blazers on Saturday.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) is likely out for the upcoming week.
James Young (ankle) is available to play on Saturday against the Blazers.
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not play on Saturday against the Blazers.
Jeremy Lamb (inflamed metatarsal) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. the Raptors.
Tristan Thompson played just 20 minutes against the Suns on Thursday with six rebounds, one assist and two blocks.
Kevin Love (back) went through shootaround Saturday morning but is questionable for Saturday night's game vs. the Spurs.
J.R. Smith hasn't done any cardio exercises since fracturing his thumb on Dec. 20, but hopes to receive clearance to begin working out at his doctor's appointment on Friday.
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
As expected, J.J. Barea (left calf strain) has been ruled out for Sunday's game vs. the Lakers.
Andrew Bogut (hamstring) will not play on Thursday vs. the Heat or on Friday vs. the Jazz.
Emmanuel Mudiay (sore lower back) is listed as probable for Saturday's game vs. the Clippers.
Danilo Gallinari (ankle) says he will play Saturday vs. the Clippers
Wilson Chandler (personal) is not on the injury report for Saturday against the Clippers.
Gary Harris (right ankle sprain) will miss at least the next two games, but Denver is hoping he can return early next week.
Darrell Arthur (left knee soreness) will be available to play on Saturday, but will be on a minutes restriction.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope (shoulder) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. the Wizards.
Jon Leuer (knee) is listed as probable for Saturday's game vs. Washington, but will not be in the starting lineup.
David West has been diagnosed with a non-displaced fracture in his left thumb, and he will be reevaluated in two weeks.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) will miss at least the next four games for the Pacers.
Chris Paul underwent successful surgery on Wednesday to repair a torn ligament in his left thumb, and he's expected to miss the next 6-8 weeks of action.
Blake Griffin (knee) has been ruled out for Saturday night but coach Doc Rivers said that Griffin is "close to 100 percent."
Brice Johnson (back) is now able to play 1-on-1 and is nearing a return to true on-court activities according to coach Doc Rivers.
D'Angelo Russell suffered a mild medial collateral ligament sprain of his right knee and a right calf strain on Friday night and will undergo an MRI test on Saturday.
Luol Deng (wrist) went through a full practice on Saturday and is questionable to play against the Mavs on Sunday.
Larry Nance (knee) will return to practice on Saturday and will play limited minutes on Sunday vs. Dallas.
Troy Daniels (knee) will not return on Friday vs. the Kings.
Chandler Parsons (rest) will not play against the Kings on Friday night.
Brandan Wright (left ankle) has started full-speed individual workouts and hopes to make his season debut in January.
Josh Richardson (foot) will miss at least the next two weeks of action.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Ricky Rubio (personal) is away from the team and will not play against the Nuggets on Sunday.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) has been aiming for a return near the All-Star break, according to C.F. Gardner of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel.
Anthony Davis (right quad) did not practice on Saturday.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
An MRI of Joakim Noah's left ankle confirmed a sprain and he will not play on Thursday against the Wizards.
Lance Thomas (left orbital fracture) will not suit up for Wednesday's game against the Celtics.
Steven Adams (concussion) is still in the league's concussion protocol.
Jodie Meeks (right thumb) will not need surgery and is expected to miss 4-6 weeks.
Evan Fournier (heel) has been ruled out of Friday's game vs. the Bucks.
Joel Embiid (knee/rest) will not travel to Atlanta for Saturday’s game (pre-scheduled rest) but expects to be available for Tuesday’s contest against the Clippers.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Coach Brett Brown said he thinks the 76ers will have Ben Simmons (foot) at some point this year.
Jared Dudley (illness) is expected to be available against the Cavs on Thursday.
Ed Davis (ankle) is out for Saturday against the Celtics.
Festus Ezeli (knee) will not be with the Blazers on their four-game trip, but his agent says it is
because of an impending knee surgery.
Tony Parker (foot) will miss at least two more games, including Saturday night vs. the Cavs and Monday vs. the Nets.
Pau Gasol (left hand) is undergoing surgery to repair the fracture of his fourth metacarpal.
Rudy Gay suffered a full rupture of the left Achilles tendon and will miss the rest of the season.
Omri Casspi will miss the next 1-2 weeks of action with a right calf injury.
Lucas Noguiera (concussion) will not play on Friday against the Hornets.
Patrick Patterson (knee) went through the Raptors full practice on Saturday.
Delon Wright is active to face the Hornets on Friday.
Rodney Hood (knee) will not play against the Mavs on Friday night.
Scott Brooks said that Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be re-evaluated at the end of January.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated in 10 days.
